org.apache.ctakes.core.nlp.tokenizer

Class Tokenizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ctakes.core.nlp.tokenizer.Tokenizer

  • public class Tokenizer
extends java.lang.Object
    A class used to break natural text into tokens. The token markup is external to the text and is not embedded like XML. Character offset location is used to identify the boundaries of a token.

      • tokenizeAndSort

        public java.util.List<Token> tokenizeAndSort(java.lang.String text)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Tokenizes a string of text and outputs a list of Token objects in sorted order.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to tokenize.
        Returns:
        A list of Token objects sorted by the order they appear in the text.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if an error occurs while tokenizing.

      • tokenize

        public java.util.List<Token> tokenize(java.lang.String text)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Tokenizes a string of text and outputs a list of Token objects. The list is not guaranteed to be sorted.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to tokenize.
        Returns:
        A list of Token objects.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • applyPunctSymbolRules

        private void applyPunctSymbolRules(java.util.List<Token> tokens,
                         java.lang.String text)
        Applies punctuation/symbol rules to the given list of tokens. Tokens that are punctuation/symbols are marked as such. Tokens that contain punctuation/symbols inside them are split into multiple tokens, one of which is the inner punctuation/symbol token.
        Parameters:
        tokens - List of tokens to apply rules to.
        text - The original text.

      • findPunctSymbolInsideToken

        private boolean findPunctSymbolInsideToken(java.util.List<Token> tokens,
                                 Token token,
                                 java.lang.String tokenText)
        Finds punctuation/symbols located inside a token. If found, the token is split into multiple Tokens. Note that the method is recursive.
        Parameters:
        tokens -
        token -
        tokenText -
        Returns:

        Returns:

      • isInteger

        private boolean isInteger(java.lang.String tokenText)
        Given that the token text is a number, this method will determine if the number is an integer or not.
        Parameters:
        tokenText -
        Returns:

      • applyCapitalizationRules

        private void applyCapitalizationRules(Token token,
                            java.lang.String tokenText)
        Applies capitalization rules to the given token. This should normally only be used for tokens containing strictly text, but mixtures of letters, numbers, and symbols are allowed too.
        Parameters:
        token -
        tokenText -

      • getRawTokens

        private java.util.List<Token> getRawTokens(java.lang.String text)
        Text is split based on whitespace into raw tokens. A raw token is defined as a span of text with no identified type.
        Parameters:
        text -
        Returns:
